  [2m  â”‚[0m

  [2m  â”‚[0m   - Web sitemaps or crawling (map url)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   - Local folders (map folder)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   - CMS platforms (map cms)
  [2m  â”‚[0m

  [2m  â”‚[0m   folder  Discover markdown files from local folder.
  [2m  â”‚[0m   url     Discover URLs from web sources without downloading content.

  [94mâ”Œâ”€ ğŸ¤– AGENT MESSAGE[0m
  [94mâ”‚[0m Excellent! Content discovered. Now let me fetch the actual content:
  [94mâ””â”€[0m

  [96mğŸ”§ TOOL:[0m Bash â†’ kurt content fetch
  [92m  âœ“ RESULT:[0m
  [2m  â”‚[0m Usage: kurt content fetch [OPTIONS]
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m   Fetch and index content from URLs or local files.
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m   What it does:
  [2m  â”‚[0m   - Downloads content from web URLs using Trafilatura or Firecrawl
  [2m  â”‚[0m   - Indexes local markdown/text files
  [2m  â”‚[0m   - Extracts metadata with LLM (unless --skip-index)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   - Auto-creates document records (no need to run 'kurt map' first)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   - Updates document status: NOT_FETCHED â†’ FETCHED or ERROR
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m   Usage patterns:
  [2m  â”‚[0m   1. Single URL:      kurt fetch --url "https://example.com/article"
  [2m  â”‚[0m   2. Multiple URLs:   kurt fetch --urls "url1,url2,url3"
  [2m  â”‚[0m   3. Local file:      kurt fetch --file "./docs/article.md"
  [2m  â”‚[0m   4. Pattern match:   kurt fetch --include "*/docs/*"
  [2m  â”‚[0m   5. By cluster:      kurt fetch --in-cluster "Tutorials"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m   Examples:
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Fetch by pattern
  [2m  â”‚[0m       kurt fetch --include "*/docs/*"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Fetch single URL (auto-creates if doesn't exist)     kurt fetch --url
  [2m  â”‚[0m       "https://example.com/article"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Fetch specific URLs (auto-creates if don't exist)     kurt fetch
  [2m  â”‚[0m       --urls "https://example.com/page1,https://example.com/page2"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Index local file (skips fetch, only indexes)     kurt fetch --file
  [2m  â”‚[0m       "./docs/article.md"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Index multiple local files     kurt fetch --files
  [2m  â”‚[0m       "./docs/page1.md,./docs/page2.md"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Fetch by cluster     kurt fetch --in-cluster "Tutorials"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Fetch by content type (after clustering)     kurt fetch --with-
  [2m  â”‚[0m       content-type tutorial
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Fetch all NOT_FETCHED     kurt fetch --with-status NOT_FETCHED
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Retry failed fetches     kurt fetch --with-status ERROR
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Fetch with exclusions     kurt fetch --include "*/docs/*" --exclude
  [2m  â”‚[0m       "*/api/*"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Combine filters     kurt fetch --with-content-type tutorial --include
  [2m  â”‚[0m       "*/docs/*"
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Download only (skip LLM indexing to save costs)     kurt fetch --with-
  [2m  â”‚[0m       status NOT_FETCHED --skip-index
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m       # Dry-run to preview     kurt fetch --with-status NOT_FETCHED --dry-run
  [2m  â”‚[0m 
  [2m  â”‚[0m Options:
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --include TEXT                  FILTER: Glob pattern matching source_url or
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   content_path (repeatable)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --url TEXT                      FILTER: Single source URL (auto-creates if
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   doesn't exist)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --urls TEXT                     FILTER: Comma-separated list of source URLs
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   (auto-creates if don't exist)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --file TEXT                     FILTER: Local file path to index (skips
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   fetch, only indexes)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --files TEXT                    FILTER: Comma-separated list of local file
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   paths to index
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --ids TEXT                      FILTER: Comma-separated list of document IDs
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --in-cluster TEXT               FILTER: All documents in specified cluster
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --with-status [NOT_FETCHED|FETCHED|ERROR]
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   FILTER: All documents with specified
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   ingestion status (requires confirmation if
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   >100 docs, use --force to skip)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --with-content-type TEXT        FILTER: All documents with specified content
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   type (tutorial | guide | blog | reference |
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   etc)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --exclude TEXT                  REFINEMENT: Glob pattern matching source_url
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   or content_path (works with any filter
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   above)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --limit INTEGER                 REFINEMENT: Max documents to process
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   (default: no limit, warns if >100)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --concurrency INTEGER           PROCESSING: Parallel requests (default: 5,
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   warns if >20 for rate limit risk, use
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   --force to skip)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --engine [firecrawl|trafilatura|httpx]
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   PROCESSING: Fetch engine (defaults to
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   kurt.config INGESTION_FETCH_ENGINE,
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   trafilatura=free, firecrawl=API, httpx=httpx
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   for fetching + trafilatura for extraction)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --skip-index                    PROCESSING: Skip LLM indexing (download
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   content only, saves ~$0.005/doc in LLM API
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   costs)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --refetch                       PROCESSING: Include already FETCHED
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   documents (default: filters exclude FETCHED,
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   warns about duplicates, implied with --with-
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   status FETCHED)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --force                         SAFETY: Skip all safety prompts and
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   guardrails (bypasses: batch confirmations,
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   concurrency warnings, refetch warnings, use
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   for automation/CI or set KURT_FORCE=1)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --dry-run                       SAFETY: Preview what would be fetched
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   (shows: doc count, URLs, estimated cost,
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   time estimate, no API calls, no DB changes)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --format [json|text]            Output format for AI agents
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --background                    Run as background workflow (non-blocking,
  [2m  â”‚[0m                                   useful for large batches)
  [2m  â”‚[0m   --priority INTEGER              Priority for background execution
